title.narrative: PPKT developing into a cooperative fulfilling the demand in the market

description.narrative:
KSU PPKT coffee cooperative was established in 2015 by former employees of local NGO Jalesa. Five of the employees established the cooperative as none of the farmers were interested to do so. Aim was to improve the price of the farmers through setting up a cooperative. Veco/Rikolto supported the process as part of their collective marketing program in which farmers were linked to the market. Due to some delays, they are still missing one document to be officially registered. The cooperative is active in two districts (Tana Toraja and Toraja Utara) and 9 sub-districts in Toraja region. There are 89 farmer groups which contain the 1736 members of which 120 paid in their member capital. Harvest time of the coffee is from May to November. The coffee is produced in several regions in Toraja in altitude varying from altitude of 1,000 to 2,500 meters. There is a need for clear business plan to be able to attract finance. Stimulate internal capital from farmer members as leverage but also way of commitment. Training need for farmers and potential board members to get better understanding of cooperatives as well as understanding of internal capitalisation.
If current board members are willing to open up for integration of farmers into board position, Agriterra is willing to support the cooperative. Suggestion for this year will be to:
Draft bankable proposal Financial audit year 2017 Secure access to finance Train farmers in cooperative principles to give understanding about the role and responsibilities of members in a cooperative Coaching in financial management and governance
BHAG: In 2023 produce 100 ton of Toraja coffee and sell through café’s with most added value for the best price for the farmers. Assist the cooperative in attracting funding for working capital and investments to make it possible to produce 100 ton of (processed) coffee
